cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwave.status: There is no heatwave at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwaves, with an average of 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded was on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 16.6mm per hour was the peak rain rate recorded today ranking 2nd in our overall records.  The storm lasted 3.2 hours and 5.69mm of rain fell.  The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

storm.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.
Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The ongoing rainy stretch, 10 days and counting started on 26 August 2025 and ranks 4th in length since records started in August 2024.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (192°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.41 miles and so far today the wind run is 67.03 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 5.0°C) and outside temperature (down 3.1°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.8 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 7 mbar), light levels (up 7434 lux), rainfall (up 0.8 mm), and cloud levels (up 127 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 10850 lux), cloud levels (up 1597 m), and rainfall (down 0.4 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 126.8m lower than yesterday, 483.8m lower than the past week, 1596.9m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 565m minimum and 1838m maximum, with an average of 983.7m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1467.6m and 2580m.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, air moisture should feel ok and little or no wind. Rain showers likely, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and periods of sunshine are expected. Weather could become unsettled.
